title: 110_hr3352
content: The Act titled "Hydrographic Services Improvement Act Amendments of 2008" includes definitions for various terms. Section 302 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892) is amended to define hydrographic data as information acquired through various surveying methods and used in providing hydrographic services. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to define hydrographic data as information used in providing hydrographic services, including the management, maintenance, interpretation, certification, and dissemination of various types of information. This includes the production of nautical charts and databases derived from hydrographic data. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATOR. Section 303 of the Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 (33 U.S.C. 892a) is amended to update references and expand the responsibilities to include providing hydrographic services. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to include the creation of a Joint Hydrographic Institute and the acquisition of hydrographic data to support various purposes such as conservation, safety, emergency response, and homeland security. The Hydrographic Services Improvement Act of 1998 is amended to meet homeland security and maritime domain awareness needs, including carrying out mission assignments. SEC. 4. HYDROGRAPHIC SERVICES REVIEW PANEL is amended to have co-directors instead of a director, with voting members reimbursed for expenses. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS is also amended for funding purposes. The Administrator is authorized to appropriate funds for nautical mapping and charting functions, including contracting for hydrographic surveys and operating survey vessels. Appropriations are specified for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. The Administrator is authorized to appropriate funds for nautical mapping and charting functions, including hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, and tide and current measurement functions for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Funding amounts are specified for each function annually. The Administrator is authorized to appropriate funds for nautical mapping and charting functions, including hydrographic surveys, geodetic functions, and tide and current measurement functions for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Funding amounts are specified annually, including $28,000,000 for fiscal year 2011, $28,500,000 for fiscal year 2012, and $75,000,000 for acquiring a replacement hydrographic survey vessel capable of staying at sea continuously for at least 30 days. The Act of August 6, 1947 is amended to include a short title as the 'Coast and Geodetic Survey Act'.
